title: Decorative Serifs
content:
I've recently started working on a new serif font, which doesn't have a name yet. This began as an experiment with Serifs of a kind I've never done before, and this came out of it:  
 [http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/experimental.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123042325/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/experimental.png "http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/experimental.png")

These first few letters I did worked out well enough that I decided to keep going and produced some more:  
 [http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/allcaps1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123042325/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/allcaps1.png "http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/allcaps1.png")

At this point, I think I'm starting to have problems with weight not matching up, but I went ahead and put together some more:  
 [http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/moreletters.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123042325/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/moreletters.png "http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/moreletters.png")

I haven't done any lowercase yet. I'm playing with just using small caps, but the ones I have at the moment are just scaled versions of the capitals and will need to be redrawn eventually:  
 [http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/smallcaps.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123042325/http:/img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/smallcaps.png "http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v629/WurdBendur/smallcaps.png")

So my question is this: Are there any glaring problems you see, and what suggestions might you have?
author: WurdBendur

comments.content:
Quirky. Delicate. Love it.

The bowl reminded me of [TextDrive's wordmark](http://web.archive.org/web/20150123042325/http:/www.textdrive.com/).

I'm not sure if the upper beaks are in their best condition when faced inward, though, particularly in _G_.

Are the glyphs aligned properly? _C, G, O, Q S_ and _U_ should dip, while the down strokes in _N, V_ and _W_ should move up. Basic, right?

_O_ and _Q_ looked not quite at home in the face. Increase the pen angle, maybe? _H_ might also be too wide, but it's a matter of personal taste.
It's official, my mind can't think of details and delicate features after midnight :)
